name: Star vs. the forces of evil - Star Butterfly
description:
If you like the LoRa, please feel free to share your generated images here and leave a review (or at least a rating) for the sake of motivation and stuff ;D

For usage guidance, look into the About this version box for more information and click on Show more to get all trigger words and combinations (The trigger words in the Details box are a pain to manage).

Please contact me here on civitAi or on Twitter if you want to provide the LoRa in a generation service.

About

Well, this week I realized that there are more than 2 sessions of this series. (I watched it years ago, and it was nice back then ^^).

So I went back and watched the first two sessions, and occasionally made screen caps of the characters, because I was thinking: I want to make LoRa available to all the characters that I care about.

I start the first batch with Star Butterfly the magic crazy girl, in most of her outfits (she changes them quite often, which is nice, considering that this is a western animation series). And the existing LoRa didn't tag the outfits properly, which is the main reason why I created my own ^^.

Additionally there will be Marco's Mom and Jacky Lynn coming up this weekend, they are currently in training :D

Training

This was fun and due to the fact I wanted to train most of her outfits (there maybe some missing) I ended with 155 images. (v1 had just 128 but I actually forgot to put two more outfit to the training data. So I created v1.1)

Additionally instead of using repeats I moved to use epochs instead... this way I have way more control over the end result ^^ (But I think I nailed it with 32 epochs ;D)

This is the first time I've specifically tagged the model for specific outfits, it worked quite well in most cases (first I used deepbooru for tagging, but there was just too much unnecessary junk, so I started from scratch, and although the dataset tag editor helped a lot, it was still a pain).

Maybe I'll make an updated version to get a bit more training data for the outfits that didn't go so well. I only used the animated series, but maybe fanart / the comics could solve the problem of those missing outfits ^^
tags: star vs. the forces of evil

modelVersions.name: v1.1
modelVersions.description:
There is no need to adjust the weight (Which is quite important for me):

star butterfly <lora:starButterflyWith_v11:1>

Additionally I tagged her outfits in training so there are following (trained) options.

The outfits that did go to well:

  • For all outfits you can add or remove her horn hairband and her wand but it likes to multiply a lot xD

  • green squid outfit Her iconic green outfit with the pink squid on it for completion add purple striped pantyhose

  • green spider outfit Her green dress with spider necklace, for completion add purple striped pantyhose

  • rainbow outfit The outfit with the rainbow top

  • shroom outfitOne episode outfit... but I got quite a lot of data, it even comes with a shroom hairband

  • nightgown Her nightgown, sadly the moon on the gown did not stick, so there will be random motives but you can add or remove her sleep mask

The outfits that didn't go to well:

  • cloud outfit The blue outfit with the cloud pouch, didn't stick that good

  • princess dress Was only trained with 6 images from the opening and first scene

  • bloodmoon outfit The outfit she wore on the bloodmoon ball, didn't really stick :<

  • pie outfit Didn't not stick so good (was only shown in one episode, with many obstructions :/)
